body.p:
To his Excellency Bariah Magoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky. We the undersigned citizens of Caldwell county Kentucky have long known Thomas B Wadlington and he has ever been considered a good and true hearted citizen Known and noted for his industry and good and orderly conduct, The difficulty in which he was engaged with Milton A Cartwright did not appear to us, to be of his seeking, Nor are we satisfied that the case was presented to the Jury as it really occurred, We hope your Excellency will review the case, and give the poor man the benefit of every doubt. We desire that his case may be Judged in Mercy and regarded with favor and that your Excellency will take into consideration every circumstance that ought to operate in his behalf And we desire that your Excellency may and will be persuaded that it is consistant with your duty to extend to him Executive clemency and that his life may be spared either by a full pardon or by a commutation of his punishment yours respectfully

Jan 21st 1861
Jas A Johnson
Hooper Camplin
James E. Kevil
W Y Harriss
William Floods
Wm O, Stokes
N E Mitchesson
J,, A,, Hopson
E. M. Wood
John Satterfield
A, G, Jones
D. M. Kevil
J. B. Gore
Samuel L Jenkins
Robert Bierden
loften mitchel
J. T. Gray
Robert shepard
State of Kentucky Caldwell County. The affiant John B. Wadlington says that the foregoing persons did sign the above petition in his presence, except three, who authorized their names to be signed,

Sworn to before me by John. B. Wadlington this Jany 26 1861.
Wm Carter J P C C
